sentences.en: All the knighthood of France came to the aid of the king.
sentences.cn: 法国所有的骑士阶层都来援助国王.

sentences.en: But at any rate he got a knighthood for it.
sentences.cn: 但是无论如何,他还是因此而获得了骑士的称号.

sentences.en: He also received honorary knighthood in England in 1998.
sentences.cn: 1998年,他还在英国被封为荣誉爵士.

sentences.en: He received a knighthood for his services to British industry.
sentences.cn: 他因对英国工业有贡献而获得爵士阶级.

sentences.en: He received a knighthood in the New Year's Honours list.
sentences.cn: 他是新年受勋者之一，荣获爵士称号。

sentences.en: He was awarded a knighthood in recognition of his truly great contribution to the British cinema.
sentences.cn: 他因对英国电影的贡献而被授予爵位.

sentences.en: He was given the accordance of knighthood for his bravery.
sentences.cn: 他因表现英勇被授予骑士封号.

sentences.en: If you wanta knighthood, you might as well cry for the moon.
sentences.cn: 你若想获得爵士头衔, 简直形同海底捞月.

sentences.en: Sir Joseph's knighthood was the final feather in his cap after years of dedicated service to the community.
sentences.cn: 约瑟夫爵士的爵士地位是他数年服务于社区的最高荣誉.

sentences.en: The highest Order of Knighthood is the Order of the Garter.
sentences.cn: 最高骑士勋位是嘉德勋位。

sentences.en: The King conferred a knighthood on the brave man.
sentences.cn: 国王将爵士封号授予了这位勇士.

sentences.en: The queen conferred a knighthood on him.
The Queen conferred knighthood on several distinguished men.
sentences.cn: 女王将爵士头衔授予几位杰出人士.

sentences.en: The Queen conferred knighthood on the bus conductor at the press conference.
sentences.cn: 女王在记者会议上授予公车售票员骑士身份.

sentences.en: The Queen has bestowed a knighthood on him.
sentences.cn: 女王已经授予他爵士头衔。

sentences.en: When he finally received his knighthood in 1975 Chaplin was 85.
sentences.cn: 当他最终在1975年得到爵士封号时，卓别林已经85岁了。

words.tran_cn: 骑士的，侠义的；英勇高洁的
骑士似的；骑士的；勋爵士的

trans.tran_cn: 骑士，爵士，骑士（爵士）资格（地位、身份），骑士精神，骑士道
trans.tran_en: A knighthood is a title that is given to a man by a British king or queen for his achievements or his service to his country
